dict.string: ‚èé Edit multi-line prompt in separate window
‚èé Ask question in a new chat
OpenAI, Anthropic, and Gemini integrations with support for local LLMs
‚áß‚èé Preview prompt ¬∑ ‚åò‚èé Ask question ¬∑ ‚åò‚áß‚èé New chat ¬∑ ‚éã Back

readonly timestamp=$(date +"%Y%m%d-%H%M-") readonly uuid=${"$(uuidgen)":l:gs/\-/} readonly archive="${alfred_workflow_data}/archive" readonly archived_chat_file="${archive}/${timestamp}${uuid}.json" readonly chat_file="${alfred_workflow_cache}/chat.json"
[[ -d "$archive" ]] || mkdir -p "$archive"
# case: keep starting new conversations if [[ -a "$chat_file" ]]; then if [[ $enable_archiving -eq 1 ]]; then mv "$chat_file" "$archived_chat_file" else rm "$chat_file" fi fi
echo -n "$1" # pass through query

stream_file="${alfred_workflow_cache}/stream.txt" pid_file="${alfred_workflow_cache}/pid.txt"
if [[ -a "$pid_file" ]]; then pid="$(< "${pid_file}")" kill $pid rm "${pid_file}" fi
if [[ -a "$stream_file" ]]; then stream_file_contents="$(< ${stream_file})" rm "${stream_file}"
if [[ ! -z "$stream_file_contents" ]]; then echo -n "$stream_file_contents" else # remove extraneous user message from chat if necessary swift ./src/Message+Utils.swift "remove_last" fi fi
‚èé Ask question ¬∑ ‚åò‚èé New chat ¬∑ ‚å•‚èé Copy last ¬∑ ‚åÉ‚èé Copy all ¬∑ ‚áß‚èé Stop ¬∑ ‚åò ‚åÉ‚èé History
pid=$(pgrep say) if [[ ! -z "$pid" ]]; then kill $pid else say "$1" --rate=${speech_rate} fi
‚èé Continue chat ¬∑ ‚åò‚èé New chat ¬∑ ‚å•‚èé Chat history

#[[ -a ./src/Archive ]] || swiftc -O ./src/Archive.swift -o ./src/Archive #./src/Archive "$1"
# For the alpha version I'm including a compiled executable of the script # TODO: Dependency Handling xattr -d com.apple.quarantine ./src/Archive >/dev/null 2>&1 ./src/Archive "$1"

readonly timestamp=$(date +"%Y%m%d-%H%M-") readonly uuid=${"$(uuidgen)":l:gs/\-/} readonly archive="${alfred_workflow_data}/archive" readonly archive_chat="${archive}/${timestamp}${uuid}.json" readonly chat_file_current="${alfred_workflow_cache}/chat.json" readonly chat_file_from_archive="$1"
# case: # Return to the archived chat selection script filter # from the chat text view after pressing escape (stacked view). # The desired archived chat already is the current chat, # the script filter just has not been updated to reflect that. # # WARNING # Correction, stacking has to be disabled for now as it may # lead to data loss. I.e. disallow the window behaviour: # `Don't close the Alfred Window on actioning result`. # Needs further testing. However, the results are at least # inconsistent with stacking enabled. #
if [[ ! -a "$chat_file_from_archive" ]]; then exit 0 fi
# case: keep starting new conversations if [[ -a "$chat_file_current" ]]; then mv "$chat_file_current" "$archive_chat" fi
mv "$chat_file_from_archive" "$chat_file_current"
Optionally, add an instruction that precedes the text.

new_bundle_id=$(mdls -name kMDItemCFBundleIdentifier -r "$1") all_bundle_ids="$inference_actions_behaviour_disable_safety_check_for_application_with_bundleID" all_bundle_ids+=", $new_bundle_id"
cat <<EOF | osascript tell application id "com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred" set theWorkflow to "${alfred_workflow_bundleid}" set bundleIDVar to "inference_actions_behaviour_disable_safety_check_for_application_with_bundleID" set newBundleIDs to "$all_bundle_ids" set configuration bundleIDVar to value newBundleIDs in workflow theWorkflow -- reload workflow theWorkflow end tell EOF
echo -n "$new_bundle_id"

![](images/ayai-header.png)
__ChatGPT__, __Claude__, __Perplexity__, and __Gemini__ integrations for chat, real-time information retrieval, and text processing tasks, such as paraphrasing, simplifying, or summarizing. With support for third-party __proxies__ and __local language models__.
--- __‚ç∫__ | Created by [Patrick Sy](https://github.com/zeitlings) | [Github](https://github.com/zeitlings/ayai-gpt-nexus) | [Alfred Forum](https://www.alfredforum.com/topic/21910-ayai-%C2%B7-gpt-nexus-chatgpt-claude-gemini-perplexity-local-llms) | [Buy me a Coffee](https://ko-fi.com/zeitlings) ‚òï ---
## 1 / Setup
1. Configure [Hotkeys](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/triggers/hotkey/) to quickly view the current chat, archive, and inference actions. * For instance <kbd>‚å•‚áßA</kbd>, <kbd>‚åò‚áßA</kbd>, and <kbd>‚å•‚áßI</kbd> (optional). 2. Install the [SF Pro](https://developer.apple.com/fonts/) font from Apple to display icons. 3. Enter your API keys for the services you want to use. 4. Configure your proxy or local host settings in the [Environment Variables](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/advanced/variables/#environment) (optional).
## 2 / Usage
### Ayai Chat
Converse with your __Primary__ via the `ask` keyword, [Universal Action](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/universal-actions/), or [Fallback Search](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/default-results/fallback-searches/).
![GPT Nexus keyword preview](images/preview/keyword.png)
- <kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Continue the ongoing chat. - <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Start a new conversation. - <kbd>‚å•</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> View the chat history. * __Hidden Option__ - <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚áß</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Open the workflow configuration.
#### Chat Window
![GPT Nexus chat and websearch preview](images/preview/chat+websearch.png)
- <kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Ask a question. - <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Start a new conversation. - <kbd>‚å•</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Copy the last answer. - <kbd>‚åÉ</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Copy the full conversation. - <kbd>‚áß</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Stop generating an answer. - <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚åÉ</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> View the chat history.
* __Hidden Options__ - <kbd>‚áß‚å•‚èé</kbd> Show configuration info in HUD - <kbd>‚áß‚åÉ‚èé</kbd> __Speak__ the last answer out loud - <kbd>‚áß‚åò‚èé</kbd> Edit __multi-line prompt__ in separate window * <kbd>‚áß</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Switch to Editor / Markdown preview * <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Ask the question. * <kbd>‚áß‚åò‚èé</kbd> Start a new conversation.
#### Chat History
![Chat history preview](images/preview/history.png)
- Type to filter archived chats based on your query. - <kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Continue archived chat. - <kbd>‚å•</kbd> View the modification date. - <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Reveal the chat file in Finder. - <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>L</kbd> Inspect the unabridged preview as [Large Type](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/large-type/). - <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚áß</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Send conversation to the trash.
### Inference Actions¬π
> Inference Actions provide a suite of language tools for text generation and transformation. These tools enable summarization, clarification, concise writing, and tone adjustment for selected text. They can also correct spelling, expand and paraphrase text, follow instructions, answer questions, and improve text in other ways.
Access a list of all available actions via the [Universal Action](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/universal-actions/) or by setting the [Hotkey](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/triggers/hotkey/) trigger.
![Universal Action Preview](images/preview/universal-action.png) ![Inference Actions Preview](images/preview/generate.png)
- <kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> Generate the result using the configured default strategy. - <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> __Paste__ the result and replace selection. - <kbd>‚å•</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> __Stream__ the result and preserve selection. - <kbd>‚åÉ</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> __Copy__ the result to clipboard.
---
## 3 / Prompting
> A prompt is the text that you give the model to elicit, or "prompt," a relevant output. A prompt is usually in the form of a question or instructions.
### References
- [General prompt engineering guide](https://www.promptingguide.ai/) - [OpenAI prompt engineering guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/prompt-engineering) | [Prompt Gallery](https://platform.openai.com/docs/examples) - [Anthropic prompt engineering guide](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/prompt-engineering) | [Prompt Gallery](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/prompt-library/library) - [Google AI prompt engineering guide](https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/prompting-intro) | [Prompt Gallery](https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/prompts)
---
## 4 / Configuration
### Primary
The *primary* configuration setting determines the service that is used for conversations and inference tasks.
#### OpenAI Proxies¬≤
If you want to use a third party proxy, define the correlating `host`, `path`, `API key`, `model`, and if required the `url scheme` or `port` in the [environment variables](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/advanced/variables/#environment). The variables are prefixed as alternatives to OpenAI, because *Ayai* expects the returned stream events and errors to mirror the shape of those returned by the OpenAI API.
#### Local LM's¬≥
If you want to use a local language model, define the correlating `url scheme`, `host`, `port`, `path`, and if required the `model` in the [environment variables](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/advanced/variables/#environment) to establish a connection to the local HTTP initiated and maintained by the method of your choice. The variables are prefixed as alternatives to OpenAI, because *Ayai* expects the returned stream events and errors to mirror the shape of those returned by the OpenAI API.
__Note__: Additional stop sequences can be provided via the shared `finish_reasons` environment variable.
---
### System Prompt
A system prompt is a way to provide context, instructions, and guidelines to a language model before presenting it with a question or task. By using a system prompt, you can set the stage for the conversation, specifying the model's role, personality, tone, or any other relevant information that will help it better understand and respond to your input. ([@](https://docs.anthropic.com/claude/docs/system-prompts))
__Note:__ OpenAI shares some tactics for effective [prompt engineering](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/prompt-engineering). __Note:__ Using [Perplexity](https://docs.perplexity.ai/docs/model-cards#online-llms), the search subsystem of the Online LLMs do not attend to the system prompt.
__Simple examples you can try:__ - `Be clear and concise.` - `Use markdown formatting to emphasize your points.` - `Explain your reasoning step by step.` ([@](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/let-claude-think))
---
### Models
If you opt in to using more expensive models, be aware of their prices and consider starting new conversations often to avoid paying for unnecessarily large chat histories included in the context window.
#### OpenAI Model Information
> __GPT 4o mini__‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ$0.15‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ/‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ$0.60‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ¬∑‚Äâ‚Äâ _128k_ > __GPT 4o__‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ ‚Äâ‚Äâ$2.50‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ/‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ$10.00‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ¬∑ _128k_ > __OpenAI o1-mini__ ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ $3.00‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ/‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ$12.00‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ¬∑ _128k_ > __OpenAI o1-preview__ ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ $15.00‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ/‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ$60.00‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ‚Äâ¬∑ _128k_ > *Per M input / output tokens* ¬∑ context window | [09.10.2024](https://openai.com/api/pricing/)

## Footnotes
¬π *Ayai* will make sure that the frontmost application accepts text input before streaming or pasting, and will simply copy the result to the clipboard if it does not. This requires [accessibility access](https://support.apple.com/guide/mac-help/allow-accessibility-apps-to-access-your-mac-mh43185/mac), which you may need to grant in order to use inference actions. ¬≤ Third party proxies such as [OpenRouter](https://openrouter.ai/), [Groq](https://groq.com/), [Fireworks](https://fireworks.ai/) or [Together.ai](https://www.together.ai/) (see [wiki](https://github.com/zeitlings/ayai-gpt-nexus/wiki)). ¬≥ Local HTTP servers can be set up with interfaces such as [LM Studio](https://lmstudio.ai/) or [Ollama](https://ollama.com/).
Utility to add an application's bundle identifier to the Inference Action safty-check ignore list
View chat history and continue previous chats
The primary setting defines which service is used for inference.

The maximum length setting determines the maximum number of output tokens (words or subwords) that the model will generate. Once the model has generated the specified number of output tokens, it will stop producing any further text.
Truncate by summarizing chat history instead

The context setting determines at which point previously sent messages will be ignored. Instead of truncating the chat history, you can also opt in to generate and inject a summary of the overflowing dialog into the system prompt (WIP).
The temperature setting determines the balance between predictability and creativity in the language model's responses.
Start or stop speaking the last message with ‚åÉ‚áß‚èé
Search the internet to retrieve real time information. (Works with OpenAI models. Requires Exa.ai or Azure API key)
Microsoft Azure Subscription API token for Bing Search
The generate setting determines the default output behaviour of inference actions.

Enter the bundle identifiers of the applications for which you want to disable the safety feature when using inference actions.
The text input fields of some applications, such as Apple Mail, are not registered as such, causing an opt-out of the stream and paste behaviour when generating inline text. By declaring an exception for these applications, the output will always be streamed or pasted. You must ensure that inference actions are only used when a text view that accepts text is focused. Use at your own discretion.
